Journal.Title: Brazilian journal of medical and biological research = Revista brasileira de pesquisas medicas e biologicas

Article.ArticleTitle: Clinical trial of Myrcia uniflora and Bauhinia forficata leaf extracts in normal and diabetic patients.

AbstractText: 1. Myrcia uniflora and Bauhinia forficata were compared with placebo for their hypoglycemic effect in randomized cross-over double-blind studies in 2 groups of normal subjects (10 subjects each) and 2 groups of Type II diabetic patients (18 in the M. uniflora group and 16 in the B. forficata group). The protocol with each plant lasted 56 days. 2. After the ingestion of infusions of 3 g leaves/day of M. uniflora and B. forficata leaves, no acute or chronic effects on plasma glucose levels or glycated hemoglobin were found in either group. However, plasma insulin levels in the diabetic group were lower after M. uniflora than after placebo. 3. Among other clinical parameters tested, a statistically significant difference was found only in the alkaline phosphatase level after placebo compared with that after M. uniflora in the normal group. 4. There were no differences in any clinical parameters after the use of placebo or of B. forficata. 5. We conclude that infusions prepared from the leaves of M. uniflora or B. forficata have no hypoglycemic effect on normal subjects or Type II diabetic patients.
